meanings.definition: To make (something) seem more dramatic than necessary.
meanings.sent1: She always overdramatizes minor issues, making them seem like major crises.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overdramatize his stories, adding unnecessary excitement.
meanings.sent3: The way she overdramatizes spilling a glass of water is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to overdramatize every situation turns life into a never-ending soap opera.
meanings.sent5: The movie director overdramatizes every scene, leaving no room for subtlety.

meanings.definition: To exaggerate the dramatic aspects of (something).
meanings.sent1: The author overdramatizes the characters in her novel, making them larger than life.
meanings.sent2: Some news outlets tend to overdramatize events to attract more viewers.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to overdramatize his cooking disasters always brings laughter to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The artist overdramatizes the colors in his paintings, creating a surreal effect.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech overdramatizes the challenges we face, instilling fear in the audience.
